newsitem.title: UK: Both Brent dates kept from chains - trade.
newsitem.headline: Both Brent dates kept from chains - trade.

text.p: Both of the Brent cargoes nominated from the paper chains on Thursday were kept ahead of the five o'clock deadline, traders said.
One cargo, loading May 23-25, was kept by the equity holder BP. The other, advanced from its original loading dates of May 28-30 to May 23-25, was kept by equity holder Shell UK, they said.
Brent cargoes are traded on a paper, or forward market until the 1700 London time deadline on the nearest trading day 15 days before their assigned loading date.
A trading company is clocked when it is left with a paper cargo which has turned physical after that deadline and therefore cannot be passed on as part of pre-sold paper cargo deals.
